channel.title: Other people can't log in to my server
channel.description:
So, I started off with hamachi. no one could connect to my server. its been like this since i got my new computer it worked on my old one, same source, same client and everything. I've tried letting hamachi go through my firewall and everything, still didnt work. so i decided to try to portforward my server. I'm not 100% sure it worked, but when i used the port check tool thing on my no-ip DUC client it said it could connect. Also tried making a webclient on rs-ps . org and if you don't already know, your server needs to be online for that. So when i tired making it, it worked. but client won't run on that site, but tahts another story. Anyyways, when [i]I[/i] try to connect with a client to my server using the same ip from hamachi, or when i portforwarded i used my no-ip adress, it worked. but other people can't connect. ive tried like everything i can think of. Can anyone tell me whats wrong ?
EDIIT: idk what i did, but i can get people online my server now lmfao. its great. thanks anyways though.

item.title: Other people can't log in to my server
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Decronix:

Do you have anything interuppting the connection? As many of the others said, check your ADVANCED* firewall settings and allow inbound and outbound, also, make sure you don’t have programs like Utorrent with upnp NAT etc already using port 43594

If his firewall was set to off it has no affect.

Read full topic
item.source: Other people can't log in to my server

item.title: Other people can't log in to my server
item.dc:creator: @mc_wobbla mc wobbla
item.description:
@mc_wobbla wrote:

[quote=“xJavac, post:11, topic:418918”][quote author=mc wobbla link=topic=521457.msg3789596#msg3789596 date=1319171788]
well if it helps, i have a bell router? lol
i checked on canyouseeme.org
it said it can connect
but also, like ive said a few times already, people also can’t connect using hamachi…

EDIT: i juust checked a minute ago on canyouseeme.org

result: Success: I can see your service on 70..*.*on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
[/quote]

Do you have any firewalls that don’t allow incoming connections?[/quote]

i’ve went through my firewall a few times. i allowed hamachi, and no-ip through. I even took the risk of trying it without my firewall on. still nothing =/

Read full topic

item.title: Other people can't log in to my server
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“xJavac, post:8, topic:418918”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=521457.msg3789577#msg3789577 date=1319171010]
Google your router name and check if its capable of pf’ing.
A looot of internet providers don’t give you decent routers with your internet packaging. To get around this or buy a new router if your router is incapable of pf’ing… or use a vps.
[/quote]

Lol isn’t every router capable of port-fowarding…? It’s just simply opening ports too allow connections too a specific iPv4 routerwise.[/quote]
Nope, I even phoned up Virgin Media about it :L. My mother works at o2 and she told me about them doing that quite commonly also when providing routers which really annoys Xbox players apparently.

Read full topic

check if the port is open: http://canyouseeme.org/ write 43594 in there.

if it can connect you havent done the no-ip correct

make sure you wrote the correct ip in your client as your no-ip
